Description: Rim sherd of Attic black-figured pottery plate; black band on edge of flaring rim; on top of rim metope decoration consisting of poorly incised spoked rosettes with added red dots separated by two vertical black bands; black band at junction of rim and floor; exterior reserved with black band around rim and one narrow black band at junction of rim and floor.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd is also published in Callipolitis-Feytmans, D., Les Plats attiques à figures noires. Paris 1974, 348, fig. 46, no. 68. The sherd was previously numbered CAM 51.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 352, no. B444)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0799) (Phase 1)
